page.title: 14Education;Murlough
page.content: Apart from the obvious educational value of the guided walks by the Wardens, the Reserve also provides a considerable number of topics for study by school groups of Geography and Biology students. Queen's University of Belfast own Murlough House and have fitted it out as a Field Centre and Conference Centre. They have built a Laboratory block and provided audio-visual facilities. The major academic users of the Centre are the Civil Engineering students who come onto the Reserve to learn surveying (a somewhat pointless abuse of a fragile environment when they could learn as much in a bumpy field!). Geography and Biology students come to study the sand dune environment.
